oai_dc:dc.dc:title: McConnell Field historic marker, Nashville, Tennessee, 1978 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An historic marker for McConnell Field that reads: “In 1927 the City bought 131 acres from Warren Sloan and made this the Nashville airport, named for Lieut. Brower McConnell, Tennessee National Guard pilot who died that year in an air crash. The hangars were 50 yards east. Aircraft outgrew the field in the 1930s and moved to Sky Harbor and Berry Field. The Park Board began the golf course in 1939.” This was Nashville’s first municipal airport, located in West Nashville and built upon a part of the Whitworth and Bosley farm. It stayed in operation until circ 1937 when it moved to Sky Harbor and Berry Field. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: McConnell family
